Nature of physical modification: Dredging of navigation channels
Effect on hydromorphology:
Morphology:
Changes in seabed structure and substrate
Depth variation

Hydrology:
Changes in depth of water column Changes in water circulation and residence time
Ecological impacts:
Loss of habitat
Alteration of key species and/or life stages 
Changes in composition and abundance of species
Decrease in water quality
Release of dangerous substances

(benthic invertebrates, macroalgae, angiosperms, fish)
GEP Mitigation measure/s:
Monitoring, assessment and information before, during and after project
No dredging in specific periods:
seasonal or tidal restrictions 
No dredging of heavily contaminated sediments 
Environment impact assessment Selection of dredging equipment 
Dredging Management Plans

Nature of physical modification: Jetties built to protect harbour entrance
Effect on hydromorphology:
Morphology:
Sediment deposition updrift and erosion downdrift of structures
Ecological impacts:
Change to intertidal and shallow inshore habitat

(benthic invertebrates)
GEP Mitigation measure/s: Sand bypassing: redistribution of sand built along the jetty

Nature of physical modification: Construction of quay walls and shore fortifications
Effect on hydromorphology:
Morphology (depth variation, loss of shallow water areas and substrate)
Change of hydrological conditions
Ecological impacts: Changes to / loss of shallow water habitats (macrophytes and benthic invertebrates)
GEP Mitigation measure/s: Conceptual measure: Development of a port and fjord action plan based on a hydro numerical model (together with the port city)

Nature of physical modification: Dredging for navigational safety
Effect on hydromorphology: Morphology (bed structure, substrate)
Ecological impacts: Changes to seabed or intertidal habitat (benthic invertebrates, angiosperms)
GEP Mitigation measure/s: Beneficially use dredged material for habitat enhancement or creation

Nature of physical modification:
Port construction as a whole
(piers, quays, bulwarks etc.)
Effect on hydromorphology: Depth, substrate, intertidal zone, currents.
Ecological impacts: Taking the e1tent of the physical impact into consideration it is assessed that achievement of GES in general is not possible in the designated HMWB.
GEP Mitigation measure/s:
Measures in general aiming at reaching GEP e.g. measures in relation to sewage and nutrient.

Specific measures can be set in the regulation of the use/activity due to national legislation.

Nature of physical modification: Dredging and removal of sediment from navigation channel
Effect on hydromorphology: Depth, substrate, currents.
Ecological impacts: Taking the e1tent of the physical impact into consideration it is assessed that achievement of GES in general is not possible in the designated HMWB.
GEP Mitigation measure/s:
Measures in general aiming at reaching GEP e.g. measures in relation to sewage and nutrient.

Specific measures can be set in the regulation of the use/activity due to national legislation.

Nature of physical modification: Dredging for navigational safety
Effect on hydromorphology:
Morphology:
- bed structure (e.g. bathymetry changes)
- bed substrate

Hydrology:
-water quality (e.g. turbidity)
Ecological impacts: Changes to seabed or intertidal habitat (benthic communities(invertebrates, angiosperms)
GEP Mitigation measure/s: hymo1, hymo2, hymo4, hymo5, hymo6, hymo7, hymo8,  hymo9, hymo10, hymoS2, hymoS4, hymoS5, hymoS6

Nature of physical modification: Non- or semi permeable protection structures (concrete, stone or synthetic)
Effect on hydromorphology:
Morphology:
- depth variation (i.e. loss of natural gradient)
-  intertidal zone structure
- bed structure (e.g. bathymetry changes)
- bed substrate

Hydrology:
-variation of currents and waves
- water quality (e.g. turbidity)
Ecological impacts: Changes to / loss of intertidal habitat (benthic communities: macroalgae, invertebrates, angiosperms)
GEP Mitigation measure/s: hymo1, hymo2, hymo4, hymo5, hymo6, hymo7, hymo8,  hymo9, hymo10, hymoS2, hymoS4, hymoS5, hymoS6

Nature of physical modification: Operations and maintenance: Maintenance dredging; dredged material disposal; reclamation and capital dredging
Ecological impacts: Direct or indirect habitat loss or change; reduced water quality; Smothering due to deposition of sediment; direct habitat loss or change due to disposal.
GEP Mitigation measure/s: Avoid the need to dredge (e.g. minimise under-keel clearance; use fluid mud navigation; flow manipulation or training works)

Nature of physical modification:
Operations and maintenance
Dredged material disposal
Effect on hydromorphology:
Alteration of estuarine processes; Alteration of natural sediment dynamics; Alteration of bathymetry. Disturbance due to
deposition of re‐suspended
sediment; increased suspended
sediment in water column.
Ecological impacts: Direct habitat loss or change due to disposal. Smothering due to deposition of sediment.
GEP Mitigation measure/s: Site selection (e.g. avoid sensitive sites) (dredged material disposal)

Nature of physical modification: Operations and maintenance Maintenance dredging; dredged material disposal; reclamation and capital dredging
Ecological impacts: Direct or indirect habitat loss or change; Increased suspended sediment in water column; reduced water quality; Smothering due to deposition of sediment; direct habitat loss or change due to disposal.
GEP Mitigation measure/s: Prepare a dredging / disposal strategy (e.g. consider frequency and quantity of dredging; phasing; forward planning)

Nature of physical modification: Structural modification E1isting modifications, including structures, reclamation and capital dredging
Effect on hydromorphology: Change in flows; changes in sediment transport; change in wave energy or direction; change in water quality resulting from changes in flows
Ecological impacts: Direct or indirect habitat loss; disruption of habitat continuity or connectivity.
GEP Mitigation measure/s: Flow manipulation (e.g. construct structures to normalise flow; realign frontage)

Nature of physical modification:
Operations and maintenance
Dredged material disposal
Effect on hydromorphology: Alteration of estuarine processes; Alteration of natural sediment dynamics; Alteration of bathymetry
Ecological impacts:
Smothering due to deposition of sediment; disturbance due to
deposition of re‐suspended
sediment; increased suspended
sediment in water column; direct habitat loss or change due to disposal.
GEP Mitigation measure/s: Manage disturbance (e.g. confine disturbance; dispose over wider area; disposal method or rate)

Nature of physical modification:
Working with physical form and function
Vessel movement
Effect on hydromorphology: Ship wash (leading to erosion)
Ecological impacts: Physical disturbance of sea bed habitats; Indirect impacts on habitats.
GEP Mitigation measure/s: Modify channel (e.g. deepen; realign channel)

Nature of physical modification: Structural modification E1isting modifications, including structures, reclamation and capital dredging
Effect on hydromorphology: Change in flows; changes in sediment transport; change in wave energy or direction
Ecological impacts: Change in water quality resulting from changes in flows. Direct or indirect habitat loss; disruption of habitat continuity or connectivity.
GEP Mitigation measure/s: Modify structure or reclamation (e.g. construct culverts in breakwaters; reduce wave reflection; increase wave absorption; replace with environmentally friendly materials or design; compensatory dredging)

Nature of physical modification:
Navigation
Vessel movement
Effect on hydromorphology: Ship wash (leading to erosion)
Ecological impacts: Physical disturbance of sea bed habitats; indirect impacts to habitats.
GEP Mitigation measure/s: Modify vessel design (e.g. shallower draft, environmentally friendly vessel design)

Nature of physical modification: Operations and maintenance Maintenance dredging; dredged material disposal; reclamation and capital dredging
Ecological impacts: Direct or indirect habitat loss or change; reduced water quality. Smothering due to deposition of sediment; direct habitat loss or change due to disposal.
GEP Mitigation measure/s: Reduce impact of dredging (e.g. dredge smaller area, shallower depth; choice of dredger type)

Nature of physical modification:
Working with physical form and function

Effect on hydromorphology: Change in flows; sediment transport; wave energy or direction
Ecological impacts: Direct / indirect habitat loss. Disruption of habitat connectivity/continuity.

Nature of physical modification: Operations and maintenance Maintenance dredging; dredged material disposal; reclamation and capital dredging

Operations and maintenance

Nature of physical modification: Deep harbours; piling walls
Effect on hydromorphology: Complete change of local conditions: deep with vertical walls. Local change in flow patterns. Reduction in depth variation
Ecological impacts: Harbours already there for long. No significant recent change in impact.
GEP Mitigation measure/s: Abandoned harbours are used to create freshwater tidal wetlands.

Nature of physical modification: Deepening Locations: Eems- Dollard; Western Scheldt, Nieuwe Waterweg.
Effect on hydromorphology:
Deepening; Tidal amplitude inland enlarged.
depth variation
structure and substrate of the coastal bed
structure of the intertidal zone
Ecological impacts: Impact on benthic invertebrate fauna; Erosion of tidal wetlands. Reduced transparency and phytoplankton production (e.g. Ems area).
GEP Mitigation measure/s: Reopening polders -> tidal wetland rehabilitation (Western Scheldt). Rehabilitation of tidal wetlands with dredged material (pilot in Waddensea and Eems-Dollard). See for Western Scheldt TIDE Program and report page 57, attached.

Nature of physical modification: Dredging for navigational safety and depositing
Effect on hydromorphology: Depth changes (dredging)
Ecological impacts: Changes/loss of benthic habitat
GEP Mitigation measure/s: For the capital dredging Environmental impact assessment (EIA) must be done

Nature of physical modification: Dredging for navigational safety and depositing
Effect on hydromorphology: Depth changes (dredging)
Ecological impacts: Disturbance of continuity for fish passage
GEP Mitigation measure/s: It is forbidden to dredge on the fish migration season (with e1ceptions)

Nature of physical modification: Dredging for navigational safety and depositing
Effect on hydromorphology: Morphology (bed structure, substrate)
Ecological impacts: Changes to seabed or intertidal habitat (benthic invertebrates, angiosperms)
GEP Mitigation measure/s: For the capital dredging Environmental impact assessment (EIA) must be done

Nature of physical modification: Dredging for navigational safety and depositing
Effect on hydromorphology: Hydrology (brackish water flow, salinity changes)
Ecological impacts: Changes of habitats (due to salinity changes)
GEP Mitigation measure/s: For the capital dredging Environmental impact assessment (EIA) must be done
